meanings.definition: A person or thing that cheeps.
meanings.sent1: The little cheepers in the nest were hungry for food.
meanings.sent2: I heard the cheepers chirping happily in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The cheepers in the pet store were all looking for a new home.
meanings.sent4: The cheepers on the farm added a sweet melody to the air.
meanings.sent5: The cheepers in the forest created a symphony of nature.

meanings.definition: The act of making a cheeping sound.
meanings.sent1: The loud cheepers woke me up early in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The cheepers of the chicks echoed through the barn.
meanings.sent3: The cheepers from the toy bird made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The cheepers of the crickets filled the night with music.
meanings.sent5: The cheepers of the baby birds signaled the arrival of spring.

meanings.definition: To make a series of high-pitched sounds, like a bird.
meanings.sent1: The birds cheepers outside my window woke me up at dawn.
meanings.sent2: She cheepers happily as she watched the birds in the park.
meanings.sent3: The little girl cheepers with joy when she saw the puppies.
meanings.sent4: The old radio cheepers softly in the background.
meanings.sent5: The cricket cheepers in the grass added to the evening ambiance.
